feed.title: NewsTracker: ukraine
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: US to expand Ukraine military training
entry.summary: The White House said Biden and Poroshenko also talked about Ukraine's efforts to combat corruption and the urgency of seeking justice in the crash of Malaysia Airlines Flight MH-17, which was shot down over Ukraine just over a year ago.

entry.title: US to expand Ukraine military training
entry.summary: Spokesman Mark Toner said the new program would increase to more than $244 million the amount of U.S. security assistance provided to Ukraine since last year when conflict between Kiev and Russian-backed separatists escalated in the east of the country.

entry.title: Ukraine's new police on charm offensive in Kiev
entry.summary:
In this photo taken, Wednesday, July 15, 2015, a couple takes a photograph with a Ukrainian police officer in downtown Kiev, Ukraine.

KIEV, Ukraine (AP) - Only a few months ago, Kiev residents would normally avoid the police if they could help it.

entry.title: Ukraine's new police on charm offensive in Kiev
Cars of OSCE observers vandalized in eastern Ukraine
entry.summary: A demonstrator uses spray-paint to deface the windshield of a car of the OSCE and the International Committee of the Red Cross during a protest in Donetsk, eastern Ukraine, Thursday, July 23, 2015.

entry.title: Cars of OSCE observers vandalized in eastern Ukraine
Ukraine's justice ministry bars Communists from elections
entry.summary:
The Communist party has been an important force in Ukraine, polling 13 percent in the 2012 parliamentary election, but its popularity plummeted over its support for ex-President Viktor Yunukovych.

Ukraine passed several laws in April banning the use of symbols from the Soviet years and denouncing Communist ideology.

entry.title: Ukraine's justice ministry bars Communists from running in upcoming local elections
entry.summary:
KIEV, Ukraine - Ukraine's justice ministry has barred three Communist parties from running in the upcoming local elections, citing recent legislation.

In last year's parliamentary election the Communist Party of Ukraine garnered less than 4 percent of the vote.

entry.title: Ukraine's Justice Ministry Bars Communists From Elections
Volunteer Named Governor in Eastern Ukraine
Russian ex-PM's daughter under fire for leaving for Ukraine
entry.summary: The daughter of a former Russian prime minister has accepted the job of deputy governor in a Ukrainian region, a decision that has sparked criticism in both Russia and Ukraine.

entry.title: Russian ex-PM's daughter under fire for leaving for Ukraine
entry.summary: In Ukraine, she has been criticized for being hesitant to denounce Russia's annexation of the Crimean peninsula.

entry.title: Ukraine rebels say their small weapons pullback is beginning
entry.summary: The rebels said tanks and armored vehicles with weapons under 100mm would be pulled back three kilometers (two miles) from most of front line in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Intensified shelling in east Ukraine kills four civilians, soldier
entry.summary: Ukraine and pro-Russian rebels accused each other on Saturday of shelling residential areas despite a ceasefire, reporting four civilians and one soldier killed following a week of the deadliest fighting in over a month.

entry.title: Intensified shelling in east Ukraine kills four civilians, soldier
entry.summary: Rebels meanwhile accused Ukraine of intensifying their assault.

entry.title: MH17 crash: Ukraine points finger at Russia as families mark anniversary
entry.summary: Ukraine has consistently blamed Russia, but President Petro Poroshenko's comments were his most direct to date.

entry.title: Both sides of Ukraine's war mark 1 year since MH17 downing
entry.summary: Speaking in Kiev late Thursday, Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said the flight was the victim of a "terrorist attack launched from the territory occupied by Russian-backed militants in the east of Ukraine."

entry.title: Ukraine calls local elections but not in rebel-held east
entry.summary: KIEV, Ukraine (AP) - The Ukrainian parliament has voted to call a local election across the country in October, but not in the rebel-occupied east.

entry.title: Ukraine, Australia mark sombre anniversary of Malaysian jet's downing
entry.summary: Australia, Belgium, Malaysia, the Netherlands and Ukraine have asked the United Nations Security Council to establish an international criminal tribunal to prosecute those responsible for shooting down the plane.

entry.title: Australia unveils memorial for victims of Malaysian plane shot down over Ukraine 1 year ago
Australia unveils memorial for victims of Malaysian plane shot down over Ukraine 1 year ago
entry.summary:
SYDNEY - Australia is holding a memorial service to mark the anniversary of the Malaysian jetliner that was shot down over eastern Ukraine.

The plane was heading from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur when it was shot down over war-ravaged eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Little certainty 1 year after airliner shot down in Ukraine
entry.summary: A year since a Malaysia Airlines Boeing 777 was blown out of the sky over war-ravaged eastern Ukraine, killing 298 people, there has been little definitive progress in determining what brought down Flight MH17.

entry.title: Little certainty 1 year after airliner shot down in Ukraine
entry.summary:
A draft version of the final report was circulated this month to representatives of Malaysia, Ukraine, the U.S., Russia, Britain, Australia and the Netherlands for their comments and suggested revisions.

The probe is being led by The Netherlands because 196 of the victims were Dutch, and Ukraine agreed to give Holland formal responsibility for the investigation.

This investigation includes authorities from Ukraine, Malaysia and other countries whose nationals were among the victims, but Russia is not a participant.

entry.title: Little certainty 1 year after airliner shot down in Ukraine
entry.summary: In any case, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said, Ukraine is morally responsible for the crash because it occurred in a war that Russia claims was launched by Ukraine.

entry.title: Fighting surges in east Ukraine
entry.summary: Manouvering in the Donetsk region of Ukraine, where fighting has surged in recent days.

entry.title: A year later, MH17 relatives grieve, wait for answers
entry.summary: FILE - In this July 17, 2014, file photo, a woman with a child walks past the crash site of a passenger plane near the village of Grabovo, Ukraine.

entry.title: A year later, MH17 relatives grieve, wait for answers
entry.summary: For many families of the 298 people killed when Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was brought down July 17 last year over eastern Ukraine, uncertainty and agonizing waiting is still woven into the fabric of life a year later.

entry.title: Canada and Ukraine announce 'milestone' free trade agreement
entry.summary: Meanwhile, financially troubled Ukraine will reduce tariffs on 86% of Canadian imports and increase exports to Canada by C$23.7m, mainly in the textile and metalworking industries.

entry.title: Ukraine PM says reforms continue despite 'lunatic' lawmakers
entry.summary: A day earlier, the International Monetary Fund insisted that Ukraine must "stay the course," suggesting that rolling back the changes could jeopardize the IMF's $40 billion support package for Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine PM says reforms continue despite 'lunatic' lawmakers
entry.summary: Ukraine's prime minister pushed back Monday against a pair of forces threatening to undermine his fragile government, likening members of Ukraine's parliament to "lunatics" while defending a nationalist militia that is locked in a standoff with police.

entry.title: Ukraine PM says reforms continue despite 'lunatic' lawmakers
entry.summary:
Yatsenyuk's U.S. visit came amid growing global concerns over proposed legislation in Ukraine's parliament that would water down economic reforms demanded by the international community.

At the White House, President Barack Obama echoed the need for Ukraine to stick with austerity measures during a meeting Monday with Yatsenyuk and Vice President Joe Biden.

The White House said Obama and Biden welcomed Ukraine's "strong stand against populist measures that could undermine Ukraine's financial stability."

entry.title: Right Sector gunmen take boy hostage in western Ukraine
entry.summary: KIEV, Ukraine (AP) - Two gunmen from Ukraine's nationalist Right Sector militia on Monday briefly took a 6-year-old boy hostage in western Ukraine as a standoff between the gunmen and police entered its third day.

entry.title: Investigation uncovers Canadian embassy in Ukraine used as a haven in 2014 by anti-government protesters
entry.summary:
That was certainly the perception of Ukraine's interior ministry, which oversees the police, national guard and the country's intelligence services.

"Generally speaking in Ukrainian public opinion, as well in the Ukraine government of that time, there was a common understanding that Canadian sympathies are on the side of the protesters, pro-European, pro-democratic."

Waschek says the safety and security for diplomats is a paramount concern, and Canada's backing of democracy in Ukraine should surprise no one.

"And as far as I can tell, the only country that has stood side by side with Ukraine has been Canada, even during the Maidan by closing the embassy in Moscow. These are the right things to do. In finding that friendship, you keep finding the strength to move forward."

entry.title: At least 2 dead in in Ukraine sports club attack
entry.summary: Right Sector was one of the most militant factions in the massive protests in Ukraine's capital that led to pro-Russia President Viktor Yanukovych fleeing the country in February 2014.

entry.title: At least 2 dead in in Ukraine sports club attack
entry.summary: At least two people were killed Saturday in a gun and grenade attack in a western Ukraine city involving the country's notorious nationalist militia Right Sector.

entry.title: Ukraine says 7 wounded in attack by armed group in western city
entry.summary:
MOSCOW - Ukraine's Interior Minister says four civilians and three police officers have been wounded in an attack by armed men whose weapons include grenades in a western city.

Mukhachevo is in far western Ukraine, near the border with Poland and Slovakia.

entry.title: Ukraine Says 7 Wounded in Armed Gang Attack in Western City
Ukraine's self-defense units look for the enemy within
entry.summary:
In this photo taken on Thursday, June 25, 2015, members of a self-defense unit carry out exercise drills in a location outside Odessa, Ukraine.

Odessa lies more than 500 kilometers (300 miles) west of the front line in east Ukraine, where government troops are mired in a war of attrition against Russian-backed separatists.

Ibrahim's background is a vivid illustration of the eclectic mix of interests encompassed by the movement that militates for Ukraine to develop closer ties with Russia instead of the West.

entry.title: Gunman kills 3 postal workers in Ukraine, steals $115,000
entry.summary: Both the government of Ukraine and its people have been under severe economic stress recently.

entry.title: Gunman kills 3 postal workers in Ukraine, steals $115,000
entry.summary: MOSCOW (AP) - An unidentified gunman shot and killed three postal workers Friday as they were transporting money in eastern Ukraine, escaping with the equivalent of $115,000, police said.

entry.title: Russia's Putin upbeat on Ukraine crisis solution
entry.summary: UFA, Russia Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that there were more chances for Ukraine crisis to be successfully resolved rather than for it to fail.

entry.title: Romania: Italian foreign minister discusses Greece, Ukraine
entry.summary:
BUCHAREST, Romania (AP) - Italy's foreign minister has discussed the situations in Greece, Moldova and Ukraine with Romanian officials.

Iohannis and Gentiloni also talked about Romania's eastern neighbors, Moldova and Ukraine, which have both signed EU association agreements.

entry.title: European lawmakers condemn Russia's actions in Crimea, Ukraine
entry.summary:
Representing more than 50 countries, 96 lawmakers on Thursday condemned Russia's "unilateral and unjustified assault on Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity."

Russia was absent from 40th anniversary meeting in the Finnish capital as its delegates were denied visas in line with the European Union's travel bans for Russia's actions in the Ukraine crisis.

entry.title: News24.com | Russia cuts off power supplies to Ukraine rebels
entry.summary: Ukraine's Energy Minister Volodymyr Demchyshyn said on Tuesday that energy-rich Russia had recently also stopped supplying electricity to the militia-run regions of Lugansk and Donetsk because bills were not being paid.

entry.title: Russia cuts off power supplies to Ukraine rebels: Kiev
entry.summary: KIEV: Kiev said on Tuesday that Russia had cut off electricity to Ukraine's rebel-run regions in what appears to be another sign that Moscow is losing interest in plans to splinter its neighbour.

entry.title: Dick Durbin letter to Ukraine PM may be Russian forgery
entry.summary: "Senator Durbin has been outspoken in his criticism of Russia's invasion of Ukraine and supportive of Ukrainian efforts to reform their economy and defend their nation," Durbin spokesman Ben Marter said.

entry.title: Correction: Russia-Ukraine-Gas story
Correction: Russia-Ukraine-Gas story
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Wednesday May 21, 2014 file photo, a gas pressure gauge in Bil 'che-Volicko-Ugerske underground gas storage facilities is seen in Strij, outside Lviv, Ukraine.

Russian gas company Gazprom halted supplies to neighboring Ukraine on Wednesday, July 1, 2015, after the collapse of pricing talks, company official said.

Gazprom CEO Alexei Miller said Russia stopped deliveries at 10 a.m. because Ukraine didn't make an advance payment for July's gas.

entry.title: Land mine explosion in eastern Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3 as fighting grinds on
entry.summary: The United Nations estimates that the war in Ukraine has claimed about 6,500 lives since it broke out in April 2014.

entry.title: Land mine blast in east Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3
Land mine blast in east Ukraine kills 5 soldiers, wounds 3
entry.summary: Despite an internationally brokered cease-fire in February, sporadic fighting continues along Ukraine's front line and each side regularly accuses the other of shelling its positions.

entry.title: Slovak agency: Russian spies increase activities in EU, NATO
entry.summary:
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia (AP) - Slovakia's spy agency says Russian agents have significantly increased their activities in Slovakia and all other NATO and European Union countries in connection with the crisis in Ukraine.

The SIS says Russia has been actively supporting the separatists in Ukraine to keep the country under its sphere of influence.

It says Ukraine's conflict strengthened the position of conservatives close to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

entry.title: NATO chief in Romania to inspect site where alliance to build facility in reaction to Ukraine
entry.summary: BUCHAREST, Romania - NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg is meeting top officials in Romania and will inspect a site where the alliance will build a facility in reaction to the crisis in Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia halts gas supply to Ukraine amid pricing dispute
entry.summary: "Gazprom is not going to send gas to Ukraine at any price without the advance payment," Miller said in comments carried by Russian news agencies.

entry.title: Russia fails to reach deal on future gas supplies to Ukraine amid price differences
Russia Fails to Clinch Deal on Gas Supplies to Ukraine
entry.summary: The current dispute comes at a moment when gas consumption is low, allowing Ukraine to bargain for better terms.

entry.title: Russia fails to reach deal on future gas supplies to Ukraine amid price differences
entry.summary: The two countries have fought several gas price wars in past years, and gas disputes exacerbated after Russia's annexation of Ukraine's Crimean Peninsula in 2014 and a pro-Russian insurgency in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: Russia fails to clinch deal on gas supplies to Ukraine
US compares China's south China Sea moves to Russia's in Ukraine
entry.summary: The US State Department's number two diplomat on Friday compared China's behavior in pursuit of territory in the South China Sea to that of Russia in eastern Ukraine.

entry.title: NATO fears return of escalated violence in eastern Ukraine - Obama discusses Ukraine, ISIS in telephone call with Putin
entry.summary: June 25, 2015: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg, second right, speaks with Ukraine's Defense Minister Stepan Poltorak, second left, during a meeting of the NATO-Ukraine Commission at NATO headquarters in Brussels.

entry.title: White House: Putin calls Obama, discuss Ukraine, IS, Iran
entry.summary: The call came on the same day NATO's supreme allied commander cited a continuous flow of ammunition and other military supplies from Russia across the border to Ukraine.

entry.title: White House: Putin calls Obama, discuss Ukraine, IS, Iran
entry.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and President Barack Obama spoke by telephone Thursday and discussed continued tensions in eastern Ukraine and the fight against the Islamic State in the Middle East.

entry.title: Vladimir Putin calls Barack Obama to discuss Ukraine and Islamic State
entry.summary: Putin, who has consistently denied backing the pro-Russian rebels in Ukraine, initiated the phone call with Obama, according to the White House.

entry.title: Putin not done in eastern Ukraine, NATO's top general says
entry.summary:
U.S. General Philip Breedlove, NATO's supreme allied commander, said the border between Ukraine and Russia was "wide open," allowing free movement of equipment and supplies.

Inside Ukraine, where pro-Russian separatists are battling Ukrainian forces, Breedlove said "we see a force that has been trained, that is led by Russian leadership, ... and is ready to do whatever mission is required of it in the Donbass (region)."
